value.title: Kamala Harris agrees with Tim Scott that the US is not racist, but says racism must not be ignored
value.excerpt: Vice President Kamala Harris on Thursday agreed with South Carolina Sen. Tim Scott that the United States is not a racist country, but added that the nation has a history of racism that cannot be overlooked.

value.title: Kamala Harris to visit Milwaukee on Tuesday: reports
value.excerpt: Kamala Harris has another trip away from Washington planned for next week – but it’s not a visit to the U.S.-Mexico border region. The vice president on Tuesday will travel to Milwaukee, according to reports.

value.title: Harris lands new job pushing American Jobs Plan through Congress for Biden
value.excerpt: Vice President Kamala Harris was given a new assignment during President Biden’s address to Congress Wednesday night, tasked to lead the effort to push through his approximately $2 trillion American Jobs Plan.

value.title: Kamala Harris' influencer niece, Meena, 'should create a firewall' between business and family, some ethics experts advise
value.excerpt: Meena Harris, the 36-year-old influencer niece of Vice President Kamala Harris, has raised concerns among some ethics experts due to her relationship with the VP.

value.title: What Laura Italiano Said About the New York Post's Kamala Harris Book Story
value.excerpt: The journalist who wrote an article claiming that Vice President Kamala Harris' book was being distributed to migrant children has resigned from the New York Post,and said she was "ordered" to write the story.

value.title: New York Post temporarily deletes, then edits false story that claimed Harris' book was given out in migrant 'welcome kits'
value.excerpt: The New York Post temporarily deleted, and then edited and republished, a debunked article that falsely claimed that copies of Vice President Kamala Harris' book were being included in "welcome kits" given to migrant children at a shelter in Long Beach, California.

value.title: Kamala Harris cements her place in Biden's inner circle during a consequential week
value.excerpt: Vice President Kamala Harris was huddled with other White House officials in President Joe Biden's private dining room last week when the room let out a "collective exhale." A Minnesota jury had found Derek Chauvin guilty of murdering George Floyd.

value.title: Washington Post runs 'fact-check' on Tim Scott's ancestry but not on Kamala Harris' 'Fweedom' plagiarism claim
value.excerpt: The Washington Post appears quite selective when it comes to the urgency of its 'fact-checks' of certain prominent politicians.

value.title: Kamala Harris ripped by New Hampshire GOP for visiting 'wrong border'
value.excerpt: The New Hampshire Republican Party called out Vice President Kamala Harris for visiting the "wrong border" as she heads to the Granite State for a visit.

value.title: House Republicans demand answers from VP Harris on 'politically motivated' border decision
value.excerpt: EXCLUSIVE: House Republicans are demanding answers from Vice President Kamala Harris on whether a facility for migrant children in Florida has not been activated because of the Democrat's personal politics.

value.title: Kamala Harris emphasizes 'root causes' of border surge, says problem is 'complex'
value.excerpt: Vice President Kamala Harris is emphasizing what she describes as the root causes of the migrant surge at the border, calling the issue "complex" as she continues to face criticism for her handling of the crisis.

value.title: Watch live: Biden, Harris speak at virtual climate summit
value.excerpt: President Biden and Vice President Harris are scheduled to speak at the opening of a virtual White House climate summit on Thursday morning. Their remarks are expected to begin at 8 a.m.

value.title: White House rebrands Kamala Harris’ husband ‘Douglas’ instead of ‘Doug’
value.excerpt: The White House changed the name of Kamala Harris’ husband from “Doug” to “Douglas” Emhoff in an apparent attempt to rebrand him as a more serious guy.

value.title: Biden, Harris slam 'systemic racism' in US, say Chauvin guilty verdict is 'giant step' toward racial justice
value.excerpt: The guilty verdict in the murder trial of former Minneapolis police Officer Derek Chauvin "can be a giant step forward in the march toward justice in America," President Biden and Vice President Harris said Tuesday.

value.title: Florida woman charged for allegedly threatening to kill Kamala Harris
value.excerpt: A Miami woman has been charged for allegedly threatening to kill Vice President Kamala Harris, according to a criminal complaint filed in the United States District Court for the Southern District of Florida.

value.title: Kamala Harris cited Russian bounty story in general election debate with Pence
value.excerpt: Vice President Harris cited the now-backpedaled report of Russia placing bounties on the heads of U.S. soldiers during a general election debate in October with former Vice President Mike Pence.

value.title: Texas Gov. Abbott calls on Biden, Harris to apply ‘terrorist’ label to Mexican cartels: report
value.excerpt: Texas Gov. Greg Abbott wants the Biden administration to declare Mexico’s drug cartels to be terrorist organizations.

value.title: Kamala Harris Again Says She Has No Plans to Visit U.S.-Mexico Border
value.excerpt: Ahead of a planned visit to Mexico and Guatemala, Vice President Kamala Harris reiterated to reporters on Wednesday that she will not travel to the southern border, which continues to experience an overwhelming increase in migrants. Harris said that ...

value.title: Ex-Trump DHS officials say Harris needs to visit border, accuse her of dodging 'political hot potato'
value.excerpt: Former Department of Homeland Security (DHS) officials under the Trump administration on Tuesday said Vice President Kamala Harris needs to visit the border soon if she is going to succeed in her role as border czar – while accusing her of dodging what has become a "political hot potato" for the administration.

value.title: Gingrich: Kamala Harris put in charge of border 'because they knew she wouldn’t do anything'
value.excerpt: Newt Gingrich claimed Monday on "Fox & Friends" that the border crisis was not a mistake and that Vice President Kamala Harris was put in charge because they knew she wouldn't do anything to fix the situation. NEWT GINGRICH: If you look at a piece of ...

value.title: Arizona AG: 'It's important' Kamala Harris, Health Sec. Becerra visit border amid immigration crisis
value.excerpt: Arizona Attorney General Mark Brnovich discusses the developing immigration crisis at the border and further probes the Biden administration to act on it.

value.title: GOP's McCarthy says VP Harris should attend FBI-CIA terror briefing: 'I know she hasn't been to the border'
value.excerpt: House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy confirmed Wednesday he has requested a classified briefing from the FBI and CIA over two Yemeni men on the FBI’s terror watch list who were allegedly caught crossing the U.S.-Mexico border two months apart this year.

value.title: Mayorkas -- not Biden or Harris -- heading to Texas border towns Thursday
value.excerpt: U.S. Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas will travel to two Texas border towns Thursday, according to reports.

value.title: Nikki Haley blasts Harris as 'missing in action' on border: 'God help us if she ever becomes president'
value.excerpt: President Biden's "obsession" with reversing former President Donald Trump's policies is "unacceptable," former U.S. Ambassador to the United Nations Nikki Haley told "America Reports" Wednesday.

value.title: Harris: Vaccinated can be 'role models' for friends, family
value.excerpt: Vice President Kamala Harris on Tuesday urged Chicago union members to share their experience receiving a COVID-19 vaccine and act as “role models" for family and friends who may be reluctant even as Illinois prepares to open access to all adults.

value.title: See Kamala Harris’ own ‘Resolute’ desk made from parts of USS Constitution
value.excerpt: The desk was built by US Navy Seabees and delivered to the White House in February, according to outlets including Military.com.

value.title: Kamala Harris Backs Gavin Newsom As He Faces Recall Election
value.excerpt: Vice President Kamala Harris offered California Governor Gavin Newsom her backing on Sunday as polls indicated that the Democratic state leader was likely to survive a recall vote. In an interview with the San Francisco Chronicle, Harris said the White ...

value.title: Washington moves of the week: A top Trump White House staffer lands a TV gig and a former Kamala Harris aide heads to a lobbying firm
value.excerpt: Advocacy groups and lobbying firms are also hiring new talent, including a former policy adviser to then-Sen. Kamala Harris, to help shape policies in Washington. Here's Insider's rundown of the biggest staff moves for the week of March 29. Capitol Hill ...

value.title: Kamala Harris and Doug Emhoff to move into vice president's residence after two-month delay
value.excerpt: Vice President Kamala Harris is finally moving into the Naval Observatory next week according to chief spokesperson Symone Sanders, over two months after Inauguration Day. Harris and her husband, second gentleman Doug Emhoff, couldn't immediately settle in ...

value.title: Republicans try to make Kamala Harris the face of the border crisis
value.excerpt: Vice President Kamala Harris and her team are staring down attempts to make her the face of the Biden administration's response to the crisis at the border, a little more than a week after being assigned a role that positions her in the center of one of the administration's most divisive issues.
